feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Process Automation
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Process Automation Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to get nested index in SAP Build Process Automation loop for each?
entry.content:
Hi, I have automation as follows:

I am looping through list of values from excel column. I need to count index only in case the condition is met. But index is counted all the time when it gets through the loop as its based on the initial values. How to create some index variable that counts from 0 only when condition is met? Thank you.

entry.title: Error occurred while sending emails in the automation in SAP Build using the Microsoft 365 Cloud SDK
entry.content:
Hi, I follow this tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-office-integration-agent..html to create an automation in SAP Build. The automation works, but the mails aren't send to any of the recipients because of this error: 

Your message wasn't delivered because the recipient's email provider rejected it.

Diagnostic information for administrators:

Generating server: PAXPR02MB7711.eurprd02.prod.outlook.com
Remote server returned '550 5.7.708 Service unavailable. Access denied, traffic not accepted from this IP. For more information please go to http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=526653 AS(7230)

When I send an email via a normal Outlook inbox from the connected Microsoft Developer Program (trial version), it is sent successfully. I tried removing the email from the blocked senders list and contacted Microsoft Support, but so far they don’t know how to help.

entry.title: SAP BPA error: When sending an array of objects, it does not load everything into the output variabl
entry.content: Hello BPA community - I have business processes where I retrieve documents from an API. I can get a maximum array of 100 documents, each document has 50 fields. When I pass this to a script to output a structure to send to an action that has an OData object, I see that not all the data is ready to be sent; it gets cut off and I see three dots. I'm sending an image.

entry.content:
Dear All,

Thank you for your consideration.

entry.title: SAP BPA - Job creation is not allowed
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm using SAP BTP Trial account and have built an automation and registered the agent.

Yesterday, I triggered automation flow and it worked very well.

However, today when the automation starts running, it fails and returns the error ''Job creation is not allowed". There is no automation job ID recorded.

What does this error mean?

Regards,

Tri

entry.title: Custom CDS view for 4JJ Scope item
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I am currently working on mass creation of time sheet entries (4JJ) using SAP BTP Business Process Automation. For this scenario, I need to create a custom CDS view (YY1_TIME_BILL_STATUS).

My initial plan was to use the standard CDS view I_RRBCostDynamicItem as the primary data source. However, I have learned that this view is deprecated and not released, since it belongs to the old Intercompany Billing (ICO) solution. The only field I require from this view is RRBDynamicItem.

Given that I_RRBCostDynamicItem is no longer available, I would like to know how best to replace this field in line with the new ICO solution. Specifically:

  • Can the BillingDocumentItem field from the I_BillingDocumentItem CDS view be used as a replacement for RRBDynamicItem in my scenario?
  • Is this the recommended approach for building the custom CDS view?

    Any guidance or best practices on how to adapt this requirement to the new ICO solution would be greatly appreciated.

     

    Regards,

    Gunadharshini

entry.title: Outlook activities failing in automation – Is there an alternative method to send emails or a versio
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have an automation in SAP (formerly SAP Intelligent RPA, now SAP Build Process Automation) that sends emails using the Outlook activities. This process has worked for a long time, but recently it has started failing frequently due to an Outlook permission error. The issue seems to be related to Outlook restrictions or blocked access when the automation tries to send the email.

I would like to know:

  1. Is this behavior related to any version or compatibility requirement of Microsoft Outlook when using the Outlook activities in SAP automations?

  2. Does SAP offer an alternative or recommended method for sending emails that does not depend on the Outlook desktop client?

  3. Is there any official guidance on whether the Outlook version installed on the machine affects the reliability of these activities?

Any insights, documentation references, or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Unable to deploy Joule Skill in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content: Hi, I have setup Joule in our project. I am able to deploy the Joule Skill in SAP Build Process Automation. I have assigned all the roles ( including extensibility developer) to to my colleagues but they are not able to deploy Joule skill and also not able to launch it. They are getting an error saying 'Project cannot be deployed by the component 'Integration Gateway'. Project cannot be deployed in this environment because the user doesn't have the required "extensibility developer" role in Joule. Please contact your administrator to get the necessary permissions.

entry.title: I want to process approvals using a UI screen customized with "SAP Build Process Automation".
entry.content:
Everyone
Thank you for reading this post.
As mentioned in the title, I'm having trouble with SAP Build Process Automation.
I'd like to use SAP Build Process Automation to process approvals, but I'm looking into the issue of not being able to customize it (e.g., change colors using CSS or other methods) or change the design.
After researching, I found that it's possible to handle customized approval screens by displaying approval screens implemented in SAP UI5 within the SAP Build Process Automation flow.
However, due to my plan, I was unable to implement a custom UI.
So, the following points are what I'd like to confirm:
- Can I implement a custom UI created using a BAS or similar tool with the current Build Process Automation?
- Can I implement it if I'm using the Standard plan?
- What process do I need to follow to implement it?

Best Regards.
Yuya.

We'd greatly appreciate any tips or guidance.

entry.title: How to apply a filter on a single property of a data set using more than one value of this property
entry.content:
Hi,
 
We need to filter a data entity using the filter conditions input of a "Get record collection" activity in Build Apps. For this, we use the following formula in the Formula Editor:
 
{type: "and", conditions: [{type: "eq", property: ["account.id"], value: appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds[0].accountTechnicalId}]}
 
appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds is the variable where we store the values needed to filter the data set. It is a list of objects with one property (accountTechnicalId).
 
The formula works well, but as you can see, we're filtering using the first occurrence of the array only ([0]), which results in showing the records filtered on this value only. We've made countless tests but they're always returning errors, for instance:
 
{type: "and", conditions: [{type: "eq", property: ["account.id"], value: appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds}]}
 
So the question is: using the Formula Editor, is there a simple way to apply the filter using all the values stored in the variable? Else, is there some sort of "for each" activity or should we create a loop or use a JS script in the logic canva? Basically, the goal here is to apply a filter on a single property of a data set using one or more values of this property.
 
Thanks a lot for your help on this, we're stuck on this problem for quite some time now and we need to implement this urgently for a demo to a client next Thursday...
 
Best regards,
 
LM.

entry.title: Upload failed "Permitted file size exceeded" despite file being < 5MB (HCMFAB_MYPERSONALDATA_SRV)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I am currently trying to create an Action Project in SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA) by uploading an API specification from an SAP On-Premise system.

The Scenario:

  • Service: Standard SAP HCM Service HCMFAB_MYPERSONALDATA_SRV (Metadata).

  • File Format: .xml (renamed from .json to ensure correct parsing).

  • File Size: 3.1 MB (on disk).

  • SBPA Limit: The UI states the limit is 5 MB.

The Issue: When uploading the metadata.xml file, I receive the following error message:

"Invalid File. Artifact information could not be retrieved.. Permitted file size exceeded. The file must not be larger than 5 MB."

My Analysis: Technically, the file is well below the 5 MB limit. However, this specific OData service is very large in terms of schema definition because it contains EntitySets for almost every country version (e.g., PersonalData01, PersonalData02 ... up to PersonalData99).

It seems like the internal parser in SAP Build crashes or times out due to the sheer number of entities, even though the physical file size is within limits.

Question:

  1. Is there a hidden limit on the number of entities/complex types for the Action Editor?

  2. Is there a recommended way to "pre-filter" the metadata file (e.g. only keeping PersonalData01 for Germany) without manually hacking the XML structure and risking syntax errors?

Any help or workarounds are appreciated!

Best regards, Daniel Eckstein

entry.title: Increment counter function in sap build process automation
entry.content:
Hi, can someone please explain how initialize counter and increment counter functionality works in sap bpa? I am not able to make it work (count loops for example). My use case would be to increment value by 1 everytime when automation gets through the loop and condition is met. So far I am only able to retrive indexes for loops but not only when condition is met. I believe for this case the increment counter could work. Many thanks.

@Chaitanya_Priya, @peterengel

entry.title: EPD Collaboration: No workflows found in SBPA cross-subaccount setup
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am facing an issue where the SAP EPD Collaboration app cannot discover any processes from SAP Build Process Automation. The workflow dropdown in both 'Configure Collaboration' and 'Specification Types' remains empty, and the OData call to the "WorkflowProperties" returns 0 results.

Our architecture is the following:

Subaccount A: SAP Build Process Automation is subscribed and active here. This is where our processes are built and deployed.

Subaccount B : SAP EPD / IPD Collaboration is subscribed here.

Scenario: We need EPD in Subaccount B to trigger and manage workflows residing in Subaccount A.

I have attempted to bridge the two subaccounts by manually replicating the standard SBPA destinations in Subaccount B, pointing them to the Service Key credentials of Subaccount A. Specifically, I configured sap_process_automation_service and sap_process_automation_service_user_access.

I've searched but could not find any official documentation or for connecting these specific apps (EPD to SBPA) across different subaccounts. Most guides assume a single-subaccount setup where the SAP Booster handles the wiring automatically.

My questions:

Are these two specific destinations (sap_process_automation_service andsap_process_automation_service_user_access) designed to work across subaccounts for EPD discovery?

Does this scenario require an Identity Trust (SAML/OIDC) between the subaccounts for the discovery phase?

Any suggestions for this "split" architecture would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks!

entry.title: Issues Migrating from DEV to QAS Using CTMS with SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
When using SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation,
I encountered issues migrating from the DEV environment to the QAS environment via CTMS.
It seems the problem is related to the scheme version, as the release process fails.

As a workaround, I tried changing the scheme version before releasing, but I couldn’t find a successful method.
In SAP Build Process Automation, I even had to remove all dependencies to import the package, which is not ideal.

Is there any effective way to handle this migration without removing all dependencies or facing scheme version conflicts?
Any best practices or recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SAP Build AppsやSAP Build Process Automationを使用して、CTMSでDEV環境からQAS環境へ移送しようとした際、
scheme versionの影響と思われる問題でリリースがうまくできませんでした。

対策としてscheme versionを変更してリリースを試みましたが、成功する方法が見つかりませんでした。
特にSAP Build Process Automationでは、パッケージをインポートするために依存関係をすべて削除する必要があり、
非常に非効率的です。

依存関係を削除せず、scheme versionの問題を回避して移送する良い方法やベストプラクティスはありますでしょうか？
アドバイスをいただけると幸いです。
